intro: Myxospermum chylocarpum, commonly known as the golden cup moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and bright yellow to orange thallus, which gives it its common name. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rock surfaces or in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, known as sporocarps, are small and cup-shaped, containing spores that are released into the air. Myxospermum chylocarpum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
